column4: hey I have a dead computer (nothing happens when i turn it on except the fans run) and I was wondering if it's be ok to put in an Intel Celeron processor in place of the dead computer's AMD Sempron processor, just to check if that is the problem.
Unless you have a Celeron mobo, its not going to fit.
and kitche they look like the same socket

and kitche: you two are right. i hadn't compared the two processors right next to each other yet. so i guess the only two other things I can try to get the comp working is put in a different ram card and try a new graphics card (the original's built in to the motherboard)?
and kitche: my friend's computer broke and he asked me to fix it. nothing at all happens when you turn it on, nothing on the monitor, only the fans run
seems like it. so the only option is to buy a new motherboard?
eh...what sort of PC is it?
if its too old, you might end up spending a large enough amount that its not worth it.
No idea what Emachines boards run cost-wise, you might be able to.
i have to get a specific board? maybe I can find the same one and not have to reinstall their OS and loose all their data
well, no, you can actually find a lot of cheap generic boards that would do the trick quite well for $50-60
I'm not a computer builder, so i have no idea what options are open to me, or how to find a motherboard that would be compatible.

really, you need a motherboard with the same functionality. So...look for one that supports your processor type, number of hard drives, RAM type and quantity, and any other doodads you have. And you'll be set.
